title: Forces, Motion, and Simple Machines

vocab.definition: A push or pull that can make objects move, stop, or change direction
When an object moves from one place to another
A tool that makes work easier by changing the direction or amount of force needed
A simple machine that uses a bar that turns on a fulcrum to lift or move things
A slanted surface (like a ramp) that helps move objects up or down with less force
A wheel with a rope that changes the direction of a pull to lift things

teachingNotes: Use hands-on experiments with ramps, levers, and pulleys. Let students test different forces and observe motion. Connect to playground equipment.

sample.question: What happens when you apply more force to push a ball?
Name a simple machine you see on a playground.
What simple machine is a ramp?
When you pull a wagon, what are you applying?
Give an example of an everyday lever.
How does a pulley help lift a flag?
expectedAny: changes the direction of the pull

sample.question: If you stop pushing a rolling ball, what will happen after a while?

truefalse.question: A seesaw is an example of a lever.
A ramp is an example of an inclined plane.
Pushing and pulling are both types of forces.
A pulley changes how heavy an object is.
expectedAny: it changes direction of force, not weight

truefalse.question: More force always makes an object move in a straight line.
Friction can slow down moving objects.
Simple machines make work easier by increasing the amount of force you need.
expectedAny: they reduce needed force or change direction

multiplechoice.question: Which is an example of a simple machine?
expectedAny: a ramp is an inclined plane

multiplechoice.question: The point a lever turns on is called the _____.
Which change can make it easier to move a heavy box up a ramp?
expectedAny: longer, gentler ramp reduces needed force

multiplechoice.question: Which simple machine is part of a flagpole?
What happens when equal forces push an object from opposite sides?
choices: It stays still or moves steadily

fillintheblank.question: When you push a box across the floor, you are applying a _____.
A _____ is a slanted surface that helps move objects up or down.
The point where a lever turns is called the _____.
A pulley changes the _____ of a pull.
Friction is a force that makes objects _____ down.
A wheel and axle can help things roll with _____ friction.
